title: maDLC colab gets stuck
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Whilst trying out the new 2.2 version with the provided .ipynb, I enter what appears to be an infinity-loop during `train_network`. It seems that the relevant error message is `AttributeError: 'int' object has no attribute 'nb_rows'`. 


### Operating System

MacOS Big Sur 11.4

### DeepLabCut version

2.2

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

Google COLAB GPU

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a new conda environment from the provided .yaml file
2. Create new project and label frames
3. Follow the .ipynb instructions, mounting drive and creating training data.
4. When running `train_network`, it gets stuck (see log).

### Relevant log output

```shell
Config:
{'all_joints': [[0], [1]],
 'all_joints_names': ['front', 'back'],
 'alpha_r': 0.02,
 'apply_prob': 0.5,
 'batch_size': 8,
 'clahe': True,
 'claheratio': 0.1,

Starting multi-animal training....

Exception in thread Thread-11:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/threading.py", line 926, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.7/threading.py", line 870, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/core/train.py", line 80, in load_and_enqueue
    batch_np = dataset.next_batch()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/pose_multianimal_imgaug.py", line 327, in next_batch
    images=batch_images, keypoints=batch_joints
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/imgaug/augmenters/meta.py", line 1888, in __call__
    return self.augment(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/imgaug/augmenters/meta.py", line 1859, in augment
    batch_aug = self.augment_batch(batch, hooks=hooks)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/imgaug/augmenters/meta.py", line 439, in augment_batch
    attr, hooks=hooks)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/imgaug/augmenters/meta.py", line 603, in augment_images
    hooks=hooks
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/imgaug/augmenters/meta.py", line 2823, in _augment_images
    hooks=hooks
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/imgaug/augmenters/meta.py", line 515, in augment_images
    hooks=hooks
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/imgaug/augmenters/size.py", line 1652, in _augment_images
    offset_xs, offset_ys = self._draw_samples(nb_images, random_state)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/augmentation.py", line 52, in _draw_samples
    n_samples = batch.nb_rows
AttributeError: 'int' object has no attribute 'nb_rows'
```


### Anything else?
I have had some trouble with multiple Anaconda installations which have caused me some issues not too long ago, but if I understand correctly that shouldn't affect the colab, right?
And like always, can never be said enough - really love your work, big kudos to the entire team; hope you're enjoying some well-deserved time off at the moment! 



### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
